sn45.24:4.2: “Mendicants, I don’t praise wrong practice for laypeople or renunciants.
sn45.24:4.3: Because of wrong practice, neither laypeople nor renunciants succeed in the procedure of the wholesome teaching.
sn45.24:5.3: wrong view, wrong motivation, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong samādhi.
sn45.24:5.5: This is called the wrong practice.
sn45.24:5.6: I don’t praise wrong practice for lay people or renunciants.
sn45.24:5.7: Because of wrong practice, neither laypeople nor renunciants succeed in the procedure of the wholesome teaching.
sn45.24:6.1: I praise right practice for laypeople and renunciants.
sn45.24:6.2: Because of right practice, both laypeople and renunciants succeed in the procedure of the wholesome teaching.
sn45.24:6.5: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn45.24:6.7: This is called the right practice.
sn45.24:6.8: I praise right practice for laypeople and renunciants.
sn45.24:6.9: Because of right practice, both laypeople and renunciants succeed in the procedure of the wholesome teaching.”
